intro: Lithophragma trifidum, commonly known as the three-lobed rock-gourd, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, followed by orange or red berries. Lithophragma trifidum thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, arid conditions.
